授業目的:
The course objectives are as follows:
a) To become more effective English speakers
b) To learn how to plan, practice and perform speeches of various genres
到達目標: Students will be working on the following aspects of speech: voice (tone, volume, expression, pitch), clarity (articulation, pronunciation, rate, pause), organization (introduction, body, conclusion, visual aid), stage fright, audience analysis, nonverbal communication, etc.
授業方法:
THIS COURSE WILL BE CONDUCTED ONLINE!!!
Students will learn about different genres of presentations, through lectures, discussions and audio visual materials. Then, students will work on preparing their own presentation for each of those genres.

トピック.授業計画1:
In taking this course, students will become more accustomed to using English in a variety of speaking tasks. While the Oral Presentation course focuses more on the preparation and delivery of academic speeches, this Speech Communication course takes a more general approach, mainly directed at the overall development of communication skills.

This is a fun, but challenging course, in which students will constantly plan, practice and deliver both short and long speeches, either individually, in pairs, or in groups (depending on the class size). Speech activities in this course include but are not limited to role-playing, readers theatre, improvisation, oral interpretation, tongue twisters, story-telling, pecha kuchas, persuasive talks, and interviewing. The course outline is subject to change depending on the number of students who register for the course.
トピック.授業外学習2: Students will work outside of class to complete presentation slides, visual aids, presentation scripts, etc. Around 2-3 hours of weekly homework can be expected.

評価.教科書Required texts0: There is no required textbook for this course. The instructor will provide necessary materials.
評価.学生による授業評価の方法Course Evaluation by Student: Students’ evaluation of this course will be conducted in class, during the period designated by the university, making use of the standard evaluation form.
成績評価Grading0: 評価基準等　Grading Criteria etc.
成績評価Grading1: Regular attendance and active participation, 30%; Presentations, 70%.
